Title: Bash: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in Bash could potentially lead to arbitrary code
    execution.

Background.Text: Bash is the standard GNU Bourne Again SHell.

Description.Text: A vulnerability was found in the way Bash expands $HOSTNAME. Injecting malicious code into $HOSTNAME could cause it to run each time Bash expands \h in the prompt string.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker controlling the systemâ€™s hostname (i.e. via DHCP) could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Bash users should upgrade to the latest version:
